goals.question: What is the trend of natural disasters over the years?
goals.visualization: line chart of number of disasters vs year
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand if there is an increase or decrease in the number of natural disasters over time.

goals.question: Which type of natural disaster is the most frequent?
goals.visualization: bar chart of disaster type vs frequency
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the most common type of natural disaster and prioritize disaster management efforts accordingly.

goals.question: What is the distribution of deaths caused by natural disasters?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the severity of natural disasters and the impact they have on human lives.

goals.question: Which countries are most affected by natural disasters?
goals.visualization: choropleth map of disaster frequency by country
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the countries that are most vulnerable to natural disasters and allocate resources accordingly.

goals.question: What is the economic impact of natural disasters?
goals.visualization: stacked bar chart of disaster type vs economic damage
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the financial impact of natural disasters and prioritize disaster management efforts accordingly.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], errors='ignore')
    data['year'] = data['date'].dt.year
    yearly_disasters = data.groupby('year').size()
    
    plt.plot(yearly_disasters.index, yearly_disasters.values)
    
    ax = plt.gca()
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        ax.xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    plt.title("What is the trend of natural disasters over the years?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    disaster_counts = data['disaster_type'].value_counts()
    disaster_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    plt.xlabel('Disaster Type')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('Which type of natural disaster is the most frequent?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['deaths'], bins=20)
    plt.xlabel('Number of Deaths')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of deaths caused by natural disasters?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import geopandas as gpd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    world = gpd.read_file(gpd.datasets.get_path('naturalearth_lowres'))
    data_merged = world.set_index('iso_a3').join(data.set_index('country_code'))
    
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(1, 1, figsize=(6, 6))
    data_merged.plot(column='disaster_frequency', cmap='coolwarm_r', linewidth=0.8, ax=ax, edgecolor='0.8', legend=True)
    ax.set_title('Which countries are most affected by natural disasters?')
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    
    data_grouped = data.groupby('disaster_type')['economic_damage'].sum()
    data_grouped.plot(kind='bar', stacked=True)
    
    plt.title("What is the economic impact of natural disasters?")
    plt.xlabel("Disaster Type")
    plt.ylabel("Economic Damage")
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
